title: Dublin’s Housing First programme is on pause, raising questions about competitive tendering for social care services
content: “Housing First works best when it is high quality, consistent and for as long as necessary,” says Samara Jones, coordinator of the Housing First Europe Hub.

title: After years of work by council, government abruptly spiked policy meant to deliver arts spaces in the city
content: “It was hugely dispiriting,” says Labour Councillor Darragh Moriarty, who chairs Dublin City Council’s arts committee.

title: Four-person mortgages on the rise as Irish homebuyers feel the squeeze
content: Demand for four-person ­mortgages, where pairs of couples or a group can band together to buy a home, is on the rise as ­affordability is stretched to the limit.

title: Dublin’s new tallest building: This tower of darkness should never have been allowed
content: College Square was redesigned to give its residential block more impact. Why did An Bord Pleanála make such a misguided decision?

title: Govt set to sign off on €100bn National Development Plan
content: Coalition leaders and senior ministers meet this morning to sign off on the €100 billion revised National Development Plan.

title: Government planning for €200bn investment in capital expenditure over next decade
content: Minister Jack Chambers said that the money will give a “transformational opportunity” to the Irish economy.

title: DAFT.IE PROPERTY MAGAZINE
content: Tour this €2,250,000 luxurious home in coastal Malahide

title: Parenting: Summer is supposed to be the best season - until it arrives and fills you with guilt
content: Our columnist Margaret Lynch feels the warmer months aren’t always what they’re cracked up to be.
